entries.title: Walmart, CVS face trial for putting sham homeopathic products next to real meds
entries.description: A three-judge panel reversed lower courts' dismissal of the lawsuits.

entries.title: Still can’t buy a Raspberry Pi board? Things aren’t getting better anytime soon
entries.description: 400,000 Pis are still being made every month, but most are going to businesses.

entries.title: Big data trove dumped after LA Unified School District says no to ransomware crooks
entries.description: Confidential incident reports, personnel records, and more are leaked online.

entries.title: SCOTUS weighs first case testing Big Tech liability for recommending content
entries.description: Section 230 to face its first Supreme Court challenge.

entries.title: Linux 6.0 arrives with support for newer chips, core fixes, and oddities
entries.description: Intel and AMD gear, yes, but support for RISC-V, LoongArch, and Gaudi2 show up.

entries.title: After an amazing run at Mars, India says its orbiter has no more fuel
entries.description: The orbiter most definitely exceeded expectations.

entries.title: Google prototypes, open sources an extra-long keyboard with one row of keys
entries.description: Open source files for Google Japan's latest joke concept are on GitHub.

entries.title: New PS5 exploit unlocks root privileges, read/write memory access
entries.description: Hack uses FreeBSD "race condition" exploit on older PS5 firmware.

entries.title: New trailer for Wakanda Forever gives us a peek at the new Black Panther
entries.description: "Only the most broken people can be great leaders."

entries.title: The Pixel 6a for $350 ($100 off) makes for an incredible deal
entries.description: The Pixel 6a was a bargain at the MSRP, and $100 off is even more tempting

entries.title: SEC fines Kim Kardashian, warns people about buying crypto touted by celebrities
entries.description: Kardashian touted EthereumMax on Instagram without revealing she was paid $250,000.

entries.title: Bruce Willis denies selling deepfake rights to Deepcake
entries.description: Willis' agent: "Bruce has no partnership or agreement with this Deepcake company."

entries.title: Nobel in Medicine goes to the man who brought us the Neanderthal genome
entries.description: Svante Pääbo played a central role in developing ways of looking into humanity's past.

entries.title: Black holes can’t trash info about what they swallow—and that’s a problem
entries.description: Solving the information paradox could unlock quantum gravity and unification of forces.

entries.title: With orbital launch, Firefly takes an early lead in the 1-ton rocket race
entries.description: "Firefly is at the point where the only thing holding them back is execution."
